org.apache.james.lifecycle.api

Interface LogEnabled

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConfigurableAsyncServer, AbstractDomainList, AbstractFileRepository, AbstractJamesUsersRepository, AbstractJdbcUsersRepository, AbstractMailQueueFactory, AbstractMailRepository, AbstractProtocolAsyncServer, AbstractRecipientRewriteTable, AbstractServerFactory, AbstractStateCompositeProcessor, AbstractStateMailetProcessor, AbstractUsersRepository, ActiveMQMailQueueFactory, CamelCompositeProcessor, CamelMailetProcessor, DefaultUsersJdbcRepository, DNSJavaService, FetchMail, FetchScheduler, FileMailQueueFactory, FileMailRepository, FilePersistentObjectRepository, FilePersistentStreamRepository, HBaseDomainList, HBaseRecipientRewriteTable, HBaseUsersRepository, IMAPServer, IMAPServerFactory, James23Importer, JamesMailetContext, JamesMailSpooler, JamesUsersJdbcRepository, JCRMailRepository, JCRUsersRepository, JDBCMailRepository, JDBCRecipientRewriteTable, JMSMailQueueFactory, JPADomainList, JPARecipientRewriteTable, JPAUsersRepository, LMTPServer, LMTPServerFactory, MailboxManagerManagement, MailRepositoryStoreBeanFactory, MBoxMailRepository, OioIMAPServer, OioIMAPServerFactory, OioLMTPServer, OioLMTPServerFactory, OioPOP3Server, OioPOP3ServerFactory, OioSMTPServer, OioSMTPServerFactory, POP3Server, POP3ServerFactory, ReadOnlyUsersLDAPRepository, SMTPServer, SMTPServerFactory, UserRepositoryAuthenticator, UsersFileRepository, XMLDomainList, XMLRecipientRewriteTable

    public interface LogEnabled
    Indicates that a services requires general logging. Note that this log should only be used for general service operations. A context sensitive log should be preferred where that is available within the context of a call.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setLog(org.slf4j.Logger log)
      Sets the service log.
